com.k2.ConfigClass

Annotation Type ConfigClass


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface ConfigClass
    The ConfigClass annotation identifies a class an being a configuration class. Configuration classes read their instance data from a file. Either a resource file or a general OS file. in both cases the file must be a JSON representation of the annotated class. The class will read its resource automatically if it is an extension of the AutoConfigClass or if it is instantiated using the one of the ConfigUtil.read(...) methods
    Author:
    simon

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String dateFormat 
      java.lang.String encoding 
      java.lang.String filename 
      ConfigLocation location 

    • Element Detail

      • filename

        public abstract java.lang.String filename
        Returns:
        The resource name from which to read this classes instance data. Defaults to name simple name of the class with ".conf" on the end
        Default:
        ""

      • location

        public abstract ConfigLocation location
        Returns:
        The enumeration identifying whether the filename identifies a resource or a more general OS file. Defaults to RESOURCE
        Default:
        com.k2.ConfigClass.ConfigLocation.RESOURCE

      • encoding

        public abstract java.lang.String encoding
        Returns:
        The character encode of the resource. Defaults to 'UTF-8'
        Default:
        "UTF-8"

      • dateFormat

        public abstract java.lang.String dateFormat
        Returns:
        The java format of Dates in the resource. Defaults to 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss'
        Default:
        "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
